title: Use case: Budget control using the Financial Management module
content:
Following a budget or spending plan helps an organization make full use of the buying and investing opportunities. The Financial Management module allows you to plan, execute, monitor, and control your budgets and expenditure in an efficient and effective way.

This use case provides step-by-step instructions on how to manage your financial resources by comparing the actual expenditure incurred to the planned budget. With the budget and expense information, you can identify the corrective actions that are required to reach your financial goals.

Concepts

Here, we list some key concepts for you to get started:

  • Fiscal year: enables you to specify a 12-month period as a fiscal year for your company
  • Accounting period: enables you to specify any period of time within a fiscal year to cover a set of financial statements
  • Budget center: enables you to manage and analyze the budgets and their allocation in an organization
  • Budget: enables you to create, maintain, and track your budgeted costs
  • Budget type: defines the different kinds of budgets based on common characteristics
  • Cost center: aggregates the actual cost incurred in an organization
  • Cost type: categorizes the expense types from a financial perspective
  • Budget line: defines the amount of planned expenditure for some budget types in a given accounting period
  • Expense line: enables you to track and manage costs, both incurred or projected

Navigate to Financial Management

  1. Sign in to Service Management.
  2. From the main menu, choose Run > Financials.
    This opens the Financial Management module. Service Management uses role-based permissions so that you can complete a task that's appropriate to your role. The tenant administrator manages and assigns these permissions. By default, the Financial Manager role is assigned to Financial Management.

Workflow

This diagram shows the workflow of budgetary control using Financial Management.

Create a fiscal year

  1. Go to the Fiscal Years page.
  2. Click New.
  3. In the dialog box that appears, specify the name, start date, and end date for the new fiscal year.
  4. Click SAVE.
    In this example, we create a fiscal year for 2021 starting from January 1 to December 31. 

For more information on how to create and edit a fiscal year, see Fiscal Years.

Create an accounting period

  1. Go to the Accounting Periods page.
  2. Click New.
  3. In the dialog box that appears, specify the name, fiscal year, start date, and end date for the new accounting period.
  4. Click SAVE.
    In this example, we create an accounting period for the third quarter of FY2021 (2021Q3) and another one for the fourth quarter of FY2021 (2021Q4).

For more information on how to create and edit an accounting period, see Accounting Periods.

Create a budget center

  1. Go to the Budget Centers page.
  2. Click New.
  3. In the dialog box that appears, enter the values for your new budget center as required.
  4. Click SAVE.
    In this example, we create a budget center named RnD budget center.

For more information on how to create and edit a budget center, see Budget Centers.

Create a budget type

  1. Go to the Budget Types page.
  2. In the dialog box that appears, specify the name and internal code for the new budget type.
  3. Click SAVE.
    In this example, we create a budget type named HW budget.

For more information on how to create and edit a budget type, see Budget Types.

Create a budget

  1. Go to the Budgets page.
  2. Click New.
  3. In the dialog box that appears, specify the name and internal code for the new budget, and select the RnD budget center record you created in the previous step for the Budget center field.
  4. Click SAVE.
    In this example, we create a budget named RnD hardware budget.

For more information on how to create and edit a budget, see Budgets.

Create budget lines

  1. Go to the Budget Lines page.
  2. Click New.
  3. In the dialog box that appears, specify the name, accounting period, and amount of budgeted cost for the new budget line. Set Budget type and Budget to HW budget and RnD hardware budget, respectively.
  4. Click SAVE.
    In this example, we create two budget lines. One is a hardware budget line of an amount of 70,000 US dollars for 2021Q3 (Q3 RnD hardware budget line), and the other is of an amount of 30,000 US dollars for 2021Q4 (Q4 RnD hardware budget line).

For more information on how to create and edit a budget line, see Budget Lines.

Create a cost center and link it to the budget center

  1. Go to the Cost Centers page.
  2. Click Add a cost center.
  3. In the dialog box that appears, specify the name, internal code, and other fields as needed.
  4. Click SAVE.
    In this example, we create a cost center named RnD cost center.
  5. Go to the Budget Centers page, and then click the ID of the RnD budget center record you created.
  6. Click Cost Centers, and then click Add.
  7. Link the RnD cost center record to the budget center you created, and then click OK.
    Note: You can link a cost center to one and only one budget center.

  8. Save the settings.

For more information on how to create and edit a cost center, see Cost Centers.

Create a cost type and link it to the budget type

  1. Go to the Cost Types page.
  2. Click New.
  3. In the dialog box that appears, specify the name, type, and internal code for the new cost as needed.
  4. Click SAVE.
    In this example, we create a cost type named HW cost.
  5. Go to the Budget Types page, and then click the ID of the HW budget record you created.
  6. Click Cost Types, and then click Add.
  7. Link the HW cost record to the budget type you created.
  8. Save the settings.

For more information on how to create and edit a cost type, see Cost Types.

Create expense lines

To view the Expense Lines menu item in Financial Management, make sure that the tenant admin turns on Enable expense line in Administration > Configuration > Application Settings.

After you enable the use of expense lines, go to the Financial Management module again, and you will find that the Expense Lines menu appears in the menu list.

To create an expense line:

  1. Go to the Expense Lines page.
  2. Click New.
  3. In the dialog box that appears, specify the name, amount, currency, and expense date for the new expense line, and whether it’s a credit or debit. Set the Cost center and Cost type fields to RnD cost center and HW cost, respectively.
  4. Click SAVE.
  5. Repeat these steps if you want to create multiple expense lines.
    In this example, we create three expense lines. Two expense lines with a combined amount of 80,000 US dollars occurred in Q3, and the other is worth 20,000 US dollars that will occur in Q4. 

For more information on how to create and view an expense line, see Expense Lines.

You can configure cost allocation rules to generate expense lines automatically. See Cost Allocation.

Compare expenditure with budget

  1. Go to the Budgets page, and then click the ID of the RnD hardware budget record.
  2. Click Budget lines.
    You will find that the budget analysis view appears on the right.
  3. Hover over the stacked bar to view the expenditure within the budget, the remaining budget, and the overspend amount. 
    In this example, hardware expenditure in Q3 has exceeded the budget by 10,000 US dollars. You need to consider this data when making future expenditure commitments.
  4. Click the bar to view the associated expense lines.
  5. To know if projected expenses lines are within the hardware budget planned for Q4, compare the remaining budget amount for Q4 and the expense line amount in the same accounting period.
    In our example, the planned hardware expenditure is less than what is budgeted.

     
  6. Click  to generate a PDF file and view a summary of the expenses.

Troubleshoot

If you fail to get the analysis view as expected, check whether the following requirements are met and modify the configurations accordingly:

  • The budget line and the incurred expense lines have the same accounting period.
  • The cost center of the expense lines matches the cost center linked to the budget center record of the budget line.
  • The cost type of the expense lines matches the cost type linked to the budget type record of the budget line.

Related topics

Financial Management
